bug.short_desc: allow third party contributions to the context

long_desc.thetext:
I'm going to implement breakpoint support (bug 155333) for Mylyn. In order to be able to implement this and similar use cases, Mylyn should allow third-party modules to contribute own information to the context and receive them during a task activation.
Some requirements / thoughts to discuss:
- bc: older mylyn versions shouldn't be affected by additional context information
- there might be several types of contributions from third party plugins:
-- file/resource-based contributions: think of adding a breakpoint (which is basically a marker in a file) to context. If the user decides to remove the corresponding file from the context using the context editor, the breakpoint should also be removed from context
-- multiple-resource contributions: a team provider might want to add scm information and a set of projects / set of files in the context might be located in one repository. If one of many files of a project gets removed from context, the scm information for the project should stay in context.
-- resource-independent contributions: think of ECF adding irc channels to the context (better examples to come...)

I think this is a great idea. The concept of a team provider, particularly those for who Team Project Set definitions make no sense, is a terrific concept. Fully support the idea! I will happily supply requirements (separately).
There is some related code in https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/2609/ that persists branch information in the form of PSF files on a per task basis.

Proposed changes:
https://git.eclipse.org/r/#change,6052 https://git.eclipse.org/r/#change,6053
Thanks for the contributions! Please assert on the reviews that you,
1. authored 100% the content they are contributing 2. have the rights to donate the content to Eclipse 3. contribute the content under the EPL
The code reviews have been merged into master. Thanks a lot!
